briefdescription.para: test access to the given file

parameterdescription.para: can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..)

simplesect.para:
This routine return 0 if the operation was successful, or -1 if error occured and errno is set, call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it.
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Search permission is denied on a component of the path prefix or specified access to the file itself is denied.
EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: Access method not supported.
EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax or amode is invalid.

parameterdescription.para: : path of the file or the folder concerned in supported protocols (lfn, file, guid,..)
: right to configure

simplesect.para:
return 0 if success else -1 and errno is set, call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Search permission is denied on a component of the path prefix or specified access to the file itself is denied.
EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: Access method not supported.
EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax or amode is invalid.

briefdescription.para: change the name or location of a file oldpath and newpath need to be on the same catalog this functions work only with catalogs (lfc ) and local files

parameterdescription.para: : the old path of the file
: the new path of the file

simplesect.para:
: return 0 if success, else -1 and errno / gfal_posix_check_error()
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Write perimission is denied for newpath or oldpath, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)
EFAULT: oldpath or newpath is a NULL pointer.
EISDIR: newpath is an existing directory but oldpath is not a directory
ENOTEMPTY or EEXIST : newpath is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than "." and ".."
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
EXDEV oldpath and newpath are not on the same mounted file system.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: oldpath or newpath has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported
EINVAL: oldpath or newpath has an invalid syntax .

briefdescription.para: informations about a file These functions return information about a file. No permissions are required on the file itself, but — in the case of stat() and lstat() — execute (search) permission is required on all of the directories in path that lead to the file.

parameterdescription.para: : path of a file. Can be a SURL, a Catalog URL or a guid
: pointer to an allocated struct stat

simplesect.para: return 0 if success else -1 and errno is set, call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it

listitem.para:
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Write perimission is denied for newpath or oldpath, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)
EFAULT: oldpath or newpath is a NULL pointer.
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: oldpath or newpath has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported
EINVAL: oldpath or newpath has an invalid syntax .

briefdescription.para: gfal_lstat is identical to gfal_stat except for symbolic links. In this case, the link itself is statted and not followed.
create a new directory creates a new directory with permission bits taken from mode. The default behavior of this command is recursive, like "mkdir -p".

parameterdescription.para: : url of the directory. Can be surl ( srm://), local (file://), or catalog's url (lfc:, ....)
: right of the directory ( depend of the implementation )

simplesect.para:
return 0 if success else -1 and errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Write perimission is denied for newpath or oldpath, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)
EFAULT: oldpath or newpath is a NULL pointer.
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
EEXIST: file already exist
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: oldpath or newpath has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported
EINVAL: oldpath or newpath has an invalid syntax .

briefdescription.para: removes a directory if it is empty remove an existing directory, return error if the dir is not empty

parameterdescription.para: specifies the directory name, can be a surl ( srm://), local (file://) or a catalog url ( lfc:, ....)

simplesect.para:
return 0 is success else -1 and errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Write perimission is denied for path, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)
EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.
ENOTEMPTY : path is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than "." and ".."
ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: path has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported
EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax .

detaileddescription.para:
opens a directory to be used in subsequent gfal_readdir operations the url supported are : local files, surls, catalog url ( lfc,...)
name
of the directory to open
file descriptor DIR* if success else NULL if error and errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.
EACCES: Write perimission is denied for path, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)
EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.
ENOTEMPTY : newpath is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than "." and ".."
ENOTDIR: path or a component in path is not a directory.
EMFILE: too many file open by the process
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: path has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported
EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax .

The readdir() function returns a pointer to a dirent structure representing the next directory entry in the directory stream pointed to by dirp. It returns NULL on reaching the end of the directory stream or if an error occurred. struct dirent { ino_t d_ino; // inode number off_t d_off; // offset to the next dirent unsigned short d_reclen; // length of this record unsigned char d_type; // type of file; not supported // by all file system types char d_name[256]; // filename };

parameterdescription.para: file handle ( return by opendir ) to read

simplesect.para: pointer to struct dirent with file information or NULL if end of list or error, errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it
struct dirents are allocated statically, do not use free() on them

listitem.para:
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
EBADF : bad file descriptor
ECOMM : Communication error

parameterdescription.para: file handle ( return by opendir ) to close

simplesect.para: 0 if success else negative value and errno is set ( ( gfal_posix_error_print() )

listitem.para:
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
EBADF : bad file descriptor
ECOMM : Communication error

briefdescription.para: opens a file according to the value of flags

parameterdescription.para: : url of the filename to open, can be a surl, lfn, guid, local or turl the urls supported by the modules

: same flag supported value is built by OR’ing the bits defined in <fcntl.h> but one and only one of the first three flags below must be used O_RDONLY open for reading only O_WRONLY open for writing only O_RDWR open for reading and writing O_CREAT If the file exists already and O_EXCL is also set, gfal_open will fail. O_LARGEFILE allows files whose sizes cannot be represented in 31 bits to be opened.
is used only if the file is created.

simplesect.para: return the file descriptor or -1 if errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it

briefdescription.para: creates a new file or truncates an existing one

parameterdescription.para: : url of the filename to create, can be a surl, lfn, guid, local or turl the urls supported by the modules

: same flag supported value is built by OR’ing the bits defined in <fcntl.h> but one and only one of the first three flags below must be used O_RDONLY open for reading only O_WRONLY open for writing only O_RDWR open for reading and writing O_CREAT If the file exists already and O_EXCL is also set, gfal_open will fail. O_LARGEFILE allows files whose sizes cannot be represented in 31 bits to be opened.
is used only if the file is created.

simplesect.para: return the file descriptor or -1 if errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it

briefdescription.para: read a file gfal_read reads up to size bytes from the file descriptor fd into the buffer pointed by buff

parameterdescription.para: file descriptor
of the data to read
size of the data read in bytes

simplesect.para: number of byte read or -1 if error, errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it

briefdescription.para: write a file gfal_write writes size bytes from the buffer pointed by buff to the file descriptor fd.

parameterdescription.para: file descriptor
of the data to write
size of the data write in bytes

simplesect.para: number of byte write or -1 if error, errno is set call gfal_posix_check_error() to check it

parameterdescription.para: : descriptor or the file given by gfal_open

simplesect.para:
This routine returns 0 if the operation was successful or -1 if the operation failed. In the latter case, errno is set appropriately
ERRNO list :
usual errors:
EBADF: fd is not a valid file descriptor.
ECOMM: Communication error
EPROTONOSUPPORT: path has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported

detaileddescription.para: Display the last string error reported by the gfal error system for the posix API Errors are printed on stderr
Display and clear the last string error reported by the gfal error system for the posix API and similar to a gfal_posix_print_error() and a gfal_posix_clear_error()
clear the last error reported by a gfal posix function
return the current error code registered or if not exist

check the current error, if no error report return 0 else return 1 and print the error on stderr
this does not clear the error

briefdescription.para: main file of the posix lib ng
